materials.raw_text:
Calcium Oxide (CaO) - 1200 g 
 Iron(III) Oxide (Fe2O3) - 200 g 
 Scandium Oxide (Sc2O3) - 150 g 
 Silicon Dioxide (SiO2) - 700 g

sourcing.instructions: Calcium Oxide (CaO) can be sourced from chemical supply stores or online retailers. Iron(III) Oxide (Fe2O3) is available at mineral supply stores or online. Scandium Oxide (Sc2O3) can be sourced from specialized chemical suppliers. Silicon Dioxide (SiO2) is commonly found in sand or quartz powder, available at hardware stores or online.

1. Measure out 1200 g of Calcium Oxide (CaO) into a clean mixing container.
2. Add 200 g of Iron(III) Oxide (Fe2O3) to the container.
3. Next, add 150 g of Scandium Oxide (Sc2O3).
4. Finally, incorporate 700 g of Silicon Dioxide (SiO2).
5. Use a mechanical mixer or mortar and pestle to thoroughly combine all ingredients until a homogeneous powder is achieved.
preparation.raw_text:
1. Measure out 1200 g of Calcium Oxide (CaO) into a clean mixing container. 
 2. Add 200 g of Iron(III) Oxide (Fe2O3) to the container. 
 3. Next, add 150 g of Scandium Oxide (Sc2O3). 
 4. Finally, incorporate 700 g of Silicon Dioxide (SiO2). 
 5. Use a mechanical mixer or mortar and pestle to thoroughly combine all ingredients until a homogeneous powder is achieved.
